post.title: Black Lives Matter In Public Schools Is Turning Kids Into Little Marxists School systems across the country are adopting BLM curriculum at at alarming rate, indoctrinating our children to achieve Marxist objectives.

body:
As someone who is gonna be a senior seven weeks from today I’m pretty lucky to say that I haven’t heard explicitly political things in the classroom. One anti-Trump rant from my seventh grade science teacher during primary season and that’s about it in school. My homeroom teacher said she voted for Bernie right before we got out for coronavirus this past year but she didn’t get into it. Keep in mind we live in Massachusetts, but definitely a more centrist part of the state.

One of my past teachers (sophomore English) follows like all of her students on Instagram and I have seen her go off on Trump (this was around the riots) but that’s not explicitly in the classroom, if she wants to go off on Trump on Instagram that’s completely separate.

My school is not particularly woke, we have a lot of people who seem like they’re lib centers or lib rights, and it’s a chill vibe. We do have a few SJW girls and this one jock from my grade who went around screaming “DRAIN THE SWAMP!” with a MAGA hat and all, holding political debates on Instagram live, funny shit.

I think a lot of the brainwashing comes in college more than middle or high school. Luckily for me, I’m not going to a liberal arts school, and even if I did, I wouldn’t be brainwashed.

I still think that we need to make sure, especially in school years with an election, that propaganda isn’t pushed.
body_html:
As someone who is gonna be a senior seven weeks from today I’m pretty lucky to say that I haven’t heard explicitly political things in the classroom. One anti-Trump rant from my seventh grade science teacher during primary season and that’s about it in school. My homeroom teacher said she voted for Bernie right before we got out for coronavirus this past year but she didn’t get into it. Keep in mind we live in Massachusetts, but definitely a more centrist part of the state.

One of my past teachers (sophomore English) follows like all of her students on Instagram and I have seen her go off on Trump (this was around the riots) but that’s not explicitly in the classroom, if she wants to go off on Trump on Instagram that’s completely separate.

My school is not particularly woke, we have a lot of people who seem like they’re lib centers or lib rights, and it’s a chill vibe. We do have a few SJW girls and this one jock from my grade who went around screaming “DRAIN THE SWAMP!” with a MAGA hat and all, holding political debates on Instagram live, funny shit.

I think a lot of the brainwashing comes in college more than middle or high school. Luckily for me, I’m not going to a liberal arts school, and even if I did, I wouldn’t be brainwashed.

I still think that we need to make sure, especially in school years with an election, that propaganda isn’t pushed.

body: Schools are nothing more than indoctrination camps now.  If they are teaching BLM bullshit in public schools, then they need to be defunded completely.  BLM is a known shell company for the democrats, all of the global corps that donated money to "blm" that money ends up going to democrats.  Since BLM is a political organization, teaching that shit in public school should be illegal.  The only option parents have now is send their kids to a good private school for tons of money or homeschool.

body:
Lately I’ve been wondering if it’s been happening subtly all along. I’m a very critical thinker, and I’m in all honors and AP classes so I’m surrounded by the best critical thinkers, “top minds of the school” (pun intended).

Upon looking back I’m sure they’ve tried to sprinkle left wing propaganda in there at some point, but considering most of the student body doesn’t seem woke I really don’t think so. Whatever they’ve done it hasn’t impacted me.
